articles.description: Listen to Radio 5 Live commentary and follow text updates as Argentina face New Zealand in their semi-final in Paris.
articles.title: World Cup semi-final: All Blacks turn on style v Argentina - radio & text

articles.description: David Warner's superb 163 inspires Australia to a 62-run victory over Pakistan as they breathe life into their World Cup campaign.
articles.title: Warner ton inspires Australia victory over Pakistan

articles.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen heads Ferrari's Charles Leclerc and Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton in first practice at the US Grand Prix.
articles.title: Verstappen tops US GP practice before qualifying

articles.description: Former England international Paul Grayson and ex-Springbok Bobby Skinstad plot a path to victory for underdogs England in Saturday's World Cup semi-final.
articles.title: How England can upset odds and beat South Africa

articles.description: Watch live BBC Scotland coverage and follow live text coverage as Airdrieonians take on Queen's Park in the Scottish Championship.
articles.title: Watch: Airdrieonians 1-0 Queen's Park in Scottish Championship

articles.description: Watch highlights as centuries from Australia openers David Warner & Mitchell Marsh inspire Australia to a 62-run win over Pakistan in Bangalore in the 2023 ICC Cricket World Cup.
articles.title: Warner & Marsh inspire Australia to win over Pakistan

articles.description: Former British number one Emma Raducanu says she is constantly asking questions and challenging her coaches.
articles.title: Coaches can't keep up with my questions - Raducanu

articles.description: Olympic 1500m champion Jakob Ingebrigtsen and his older brothers Henrik and Filip accuse their father and former coach Gjert of being "very aggressive and controlling".
articles.title: Ingebrigtsen brothers accuse father of violence

articles.description: BBC Sport analyses why so many matches at the Cricket World Cup have been poorly attended so far.
articles.title: Why do crowds look so low at Cricket World Cup?

articles.description: Australia opener David Warner hits the roof of the stadium in Bangalore with a massive six off Pakistan bowler Haris Rauf in their ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023 group stage match.
articles.title: 'Monster hit!' Warner strikes roof with massive six
